shorts.title: Charles Hangen Joins Fidelity Bank as Senior Vice President and Chief Risk Officer
shorts.title_distilled: Charles Hangen Joins Fidelity Bank as Senior Vice President and Chief Risk Officer.
shorts.description: DUNMORE, Pa., Nov. 03, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Daniel J. Santaniello, President and CEO of Fidelity Bank, is pleased to announce that Charles Hangen has joined Fidelity Bank as SVP, Chief Risk Officer.
shorts.content: DUNMORE, Pa., Nov. 03, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Daniel J. Santaniello, President and CEO of Fidelity Bank, is pleased to announce that Charles Hangen has joined Fidelity Bank as SVP, Chief Risk Officer.

shorts.title: Gentex Corporation Secures Third Year Option on its Advanced Combat Helmet Generation II Contract Worth $38.4 Million
shorts.title_distilled: Gentex Corporation Secures Third Year Option on its Advanced Combat Helmet Generation II Contract Worth $38.
shorts.description: CARBONDALE, PA, November 13, 2025 — The Defense Logistics Agency (DLA) has exercised the third one-year option period of the Advanced Combat Helmet Generation II (ACH Gen II) production contract (SPE1C1-23-D-0004) awarded to Gentex Corporation. Valued at up t…
shorts.content: CARBONDALE, PA, November 13, 2025 — The Defense Logistics Agency (DLA) has exercised the third one-year option period of the Advanced Combat Helmet Generation II (ACH Gen II) production contract (SPE1C1-23-D-0004) awarded to Gentex Corporation. Valued at up t…
shorts.content_distilled: CARBONDALE, PA, November 13, 2025 — The Defense Logistics Agency  has exercised the third one-year option period of the Advanced Combat Helmet Generation II  production contract  awarded to Gentex Corporation.

shorts.title: Lackawanna County Court Notes, December 2, 2025
shorts.description: MARRIAGE LICENSES Linh Ngoc Tran, London, Ontario, Canada, and Jamie Joseph Spindler, Scranton. Sean Bryan Merrifield and Bianka Marie Donovan, both of Olyphant. Brett Jason Mosley and Nina Alexandra Burke, both of Clarks Summit. PROPERTY TRANSACTIONS Kane Properties I LP, North Abington Twp., to RLIF Co-Investment II Properties LLC, Annapolis, Md.; parcels in Taylor and Scranton for $11,000,000. Eric J. Youshock and Elise Stavish, Pennsylvania, to Tara B. Jones, Pennsylvania; a property at 1332 E. Elm St., Scranton, for $305,000. Francis J. and Michele Sickle to Tyler and Shana Deitrick; a property at 10 Holly Lane, Thornhurst Twp., for $530,000. […]

shorts.title: St. Mary’s Orthodox Greek Catholic Church potato pancake sale
shorts.description: St. Mary’s Orthodox Greek Catholic Church, 522 Main St., Dickson City, is holding a takeout-only Christmas potato pancake sale, Friday, Dec. 19, from 11:30 a.m.-5:30 p.m. Potato pancakes are $2 each and are great for lunch or dinner. Advance orders are recommended by Dec. 17. Call 570-309-5990. From left: Mary Ann Gieda, John Orbin and Joe Kofira.
shorts.content: St. Mary’s Orthodox Greek Catholic Church, 522 Main St., Dickson City, is holding a takeout-only Christmas potato pancake sale, Friday, Dec. 19, from 11:30 a.m.-5:30 p.m. Potato pancakes are $2 each and are great for lunch or dinner. Advance orders are recommended by Dec. 17. Call 570-309-5990. From left: Mary Ann Gieda, John Orbin and Joe Kofira.

shorts.title: Carbondale UNICO prepares meal for Ronald McDonald House
shorts.title_distilled: Carbondale UNICO prepares meal for Ronald McDonald House.
shorts.description: Yvonne and Tom Gatto, with Angel and Joe Masco, members of Carbondale Chapter of UNICO National, prepared a home-cooked meal for families staying at the Ronald McDonald House of Scranton, which provides a “home away from home” for families of seriously ill children. The service reflected UNICO’s core values of unity, charity and community — living out its motto, “Service Above Self.” From left, front: Yvonne Gatto and Angel Masco. Rear: Tom Gatto and Joe Masco.
shorts.content: Yvonne and Tom Gatto, with Angel and Joe Masco, members of Carbondale Chapter of UNICO National, prepared a home-cooked meal for families staying at the Ronald McDonald House of Scranton, which provides a “home away from home” for families of seriously ill children. The service reflected UNICO’s core values of unity, charity and community — living out its motto, “Service Above Self.” From left, front: Yvonne Gatto and Angel Masco. Rear: Tom Gatto and Joe Masco.
shorts.content_distilled: Yvonne and Tom Gatto, with Angel and Joe Masco, members of Carbondale Chapter of UNICO National, prepared a home-cooked meal for families staying at the Ronald McDonald House of Scranton, which provides a “home away from home” for families of seriously ill children.

shorts.title: Clipboard, December 2, 2025
shorts.description: Factoryville Sportsmen meet: Factoryville Sportsmen’s Club meeting, Dec. 17, 7:30 p.m., clubhouse. This change in schedule is due to the holiday season. Dues for 2026 are now being accepted. Lackawanna County Cookie walk: Friends of the Scranton Animal Association cookie walk fundraiser, Dec. 13, 10 a.m.-1 p.m. or until cookies are gone; assortment of homemade cookies for sale for $11/pound, cash only; proceeds will help homeless animals. Annual Christmas dinner: 32nd annual Bob Bolus Sr. Christmas Day Dinner, Dec. 25, noon-6 p.m., All Saints Academy Hall, 1425 Jackson St., Scranton. This free community event ensures that no one has to […]
